intro: Grymania polyandra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming dense clumps with a rosette of foliage. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color, with five petals and a distinctive spurred structure. Grymania polyandra is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
